name: 10,000 sunsets - 06.12.2021.8:32pm, Redwood City, CA
description: 10,000 Sunsets is an ongoing project documenting a personal ritual of gratitude celebrating my survival - taking a photo of the sky at exact sunset time when I’m able, till I die. As a chronically ill artist with housing insecurities, I have only the sky to ground me.//////// 10,000 is a unit of measurement commonly referred to in Buddhist and Taoist text that means the indefinite multitude of all forms and beings. In de-centering colonial standardization in measuring time, I am interested in creating my own in crip time, celebrating another day that I made it. Crip time is slow time, it’s non-linear time travel, shifting backward and forward, flexing outwards and inwards.Coined by the disability justice movement on centering disabled bodies in how we experience time differently, it rejects capitalism’s expectation of productivity, and discard universal notion of ablest time frame in honoring one’s own pacing.
